title: Martin Amis, British author of era-defining novels, dies at 73
description: The influential novelist and nonfiction writer died in Florida of esophageal cancer. His novels, such as Money, The Information and London Fields, came to define British life in the late 20th century.

title: A Maryland man has been carrying an AR-15-style rifle near a school bus stop
description: Community members from Severn, Md., have been fuming after a local resident began displaying his rifle near a school bus stop in protest of gun control legislation. Police say he's broken no laws.

title: A judge says a high school can require a trans girl to dress as a boy for graduation
description: A federal judge filed his order in an ACLU lawsuit filed on behalf of a 17-year-old against a Mississippi school district. The transgender girl had chosen a dress to wear with her cap and gown.

title: Ghost of William Jennings Bryan haunts Trump's next run for the White House
description: Comparisons between the two began cropping up early in 2016, right about the time former President Trump's candidacy was bringing the word "populist" back into the daily political conversation.

title: This high school senior's science project could one day save lives
description: An 18-year-old from Texas created an app using artificial intelligence that may someday help detect suicide risk.

title: A remarkable new view of the Titanic shipwreck is here, thanks to deep-sea mappers
description: The Titanic wreck is hard to reach and harder to capture, with most images showing just a section at a time. The first full-sized digital scan offers what experts call a game-changing view.

title: More than half of the world's largest lakes are shrinking. Here's why that matters
description: Human actions have caused "significant declines" in the amount of water stored in 53% of the planet's largest lakes and reservoirs. Climate change and overconsumption are the primary drivers.

title: Nebraska passes 12-week abortion ban and restrictions on gender-affirming care
description: The state's Legislature passed a 12-week abortion ban and restrictions on gender-affirming care for people under 19. The state's Republican governor has promised to sign it into law.

title: Influential church leader Timothy Keller has died at the age of 72
description: He was a co-founder of The Gospel Coalition, a group  concerned that evangelical Christianity had become too politicized.

title: American Airlines and JetBlue must end partnership in the northeast U.S., judge rules
description: The ruling is a major victory for the Biden administration, which has used aggressive enforcement of antitrust laws to fight against mergers and other arrangements between large corporations.
